Privacy Policy
The use of our website is usually possible without providing personal information. User data collected by the Labdoo platform is always done on a voluntary basis. Labdoo does not share any user data to third parties without the user's allowance and such data is used only to facilitate the internal logistical workflow of the project.
Users should be aware that data transmission over the Internet (such as communication by e-mail) can have security gaps and that a complete protection of data against access by third parties is in general not possible.
Information on stored data
On request we will be ready to send you related information of your personal data. To do this send an e-mail to contact@labdoo.org.
Privacy Policy for Usage of Facebook, Twitter, Google +1 and Linkedin Plugins
Our pages integrate plugins of the social network Facebook (1601 South California Avenue, Palo Alto, CA 94304, USA), Twitter (Twitter, Inc., 1355 Market St, Suite 900, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA), Google +1 (Google Inc., 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043, USA) and Linkedin (LinkedIn Corporation, 2029 Stierlin Court, Mountain View, CA 94043, USA). We will herein refer to any of these platforms as the "social network platforms" or "SNPs". When you visit the Labdoo site, the plugins establish a connection between your browser and these social network platforms. The SNPs can obtain the information that you have visited our site and your IP address. If you click on a "Like"-type button while you are logged into any of these SNPs, you will establish a relation between the content of our pages and the SNPs. Thereby the SNPs can correlate your visit of our site with your user account. Labdoo as a platform has no knowledge of the contents of the transmitted data between your browser and the SNPs. If you do not wish that the SNPs relate your visit to our site, please log out from the SNPs before accessing the Labdoo website.
For more information, please see the specific privacy policies of these social network platforms.
